item.title: Universe on a Banana Leaf
item.description: There are more stars, you used to say, than all the rice in your aluminium tub. On my banana leaf, the stars heap and watery chutney milky-ways around them, around clumps of kadle-manoli asteroids. A lone happala shines chipped in the corner, sandige moons orbiting that dwarf planet. Remember how you used to string them up and offer them to the Bhutas? Can these gods see the rings of Saturn?
